holidays.name: Uncommon Instrument Appreciation Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to celebrating unusual, rare, or lost musical instruments from around the world.
holidays.origin: Created by music enthusiasts and ethnomusicologists to raise awareness about unique sounds and musical traditions that rarely get mainstream attention.
holidays.funFact: Some instruments featured on this day include the serpent (a medieval wind instrument) and the waterphone, famous for its eerie sound in horror movies.

holidays.name: Mutt‚Äôs Day
holidays.description: A playful day to honor and appreciate mixed-breed dogs, often considered the underdogs of the canine world.
holidays.origin: Began as a grassroots movement among dog lovers to celebrate mutts and encourage adoption rather than purchasing purebreds.
holidays.funFact: Studies show that mutts often have fewer genetic health problems than some purebred dogs.

holidays.name: System Administrator Appreciation Day (Observed)
holidays.description: While officially the last Friday in July, some tech circles cheekily celebrate on July 31 as well to honor the hardworking system admins who keep the digital world running.
holidays.origin: Started in the late 1990s within the IT community to highlight the crucial, often unseen work of system administrators.
holidays.funFact: The day is sometimes called 'SysAdmin Day' and inspired many quirky gifts like coffee mugs printed with server jokes.

holidays.name: Avocado Day
holidays.description: A day to celebrate the creamy, versatile fruit loved by millennials and foodies worldwide.
holidays.origin: Not officially declared by any global body but popularized via social media and food blogs of the late 2010s.
holidays.funFact: Around July, avocados are often at their peak season in many parts of the Northern Hemisphere.
